body: Thanks! Yes, I noticed that too. I think our C++ backend cannot compile the code yet.

> I think our C++ backend cannot compile the code yet.

I am curious, Is there any particular reason it can compile a hello world program but not this?

I think it's just a bug, you can test it like this:
```console
$ lfortran --show-cpp a.f90 
Internal Compiler Error: Unhandled exception
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/Users/ondrej/repos/lfortran/lfortran/src/bin/lfortran.cpp", line 1699
    return emit_cpp(arg_file, compiler_options);
  File "/Users/ondrej/repos/lfortran/lfortran/src/bin/lfortran.cpp", line 578
    LFortran::Result<std::string> cpp = fe.get_cpp(input, lm, diagnostics, 1);
  File "/Users/ondrej/repos/lfortran/lfortran/src/lfortran/fortran_evaluator.cpp", line 404
    return get_cpp2(*asr.result, diagnostics, default_lower_bound);
  File "/Users/ondrej/repos/lfortran/lfortran/src/lfortran/fortran_evaluator.cpp", line 415
    return asr_to_cpp(al, asr, diagnostics, compiler_options.platform,
  File "/Users/ondrej/repos/lfortran/lfortran/src/libasr/codegen/asr_to_cpp.cpp", line 718
    v.visit_asr((ASR::asr_t &)asr);
  File "../libasr/asr.h", line 3818
  File "../libasr/asr.h", line 3795
  File "../libasr/asr.h", line 3819
  File "../libasr/asr.h", line 3584
  File "/Users/ondrej/repos/lfortran/lfortran/src/libasr/codegen/asr_to_cpp.cpp", line 452
    visit_symbol(*item.second);
  File "../libasr/asr.h", line 3821
  File "../libasr/asr.h", line 3593
  File "/Users/ondrej/repos/lfortran/lfortran/src/libasr/codegen/asr_to_cpp.cpp", line 485
    this->visit_stmt(*x.m_body[i]);
  File "../libasr/asr.h", line 3834
  File "../libasr/asr.h", line 3619
  File "../libasr/codegen/asr_to_c_cpp.h", line 1152
  File "../libasr/asr.h", line 3834
  File "../libasr/asr.h", line 3619
  File "../libasr/codegen/asr_to_c_cpp.h", line 1152
  File "../libasr/asr.h", line 3834
  File "../libasr/asr.h", line 3619
  File "../libasr/codegen/asr_to_c_cpp.h", line 1109
  File "../libasr/asr_utils.h", line 77
  File "../libasr/asr.h", line 39
AssertFailed: f != nullptr
```

The problem is here:

```fortran
do
                x_sqr = x ** 2; y_sqr = y ** 2
...
end do
```
The C/C++ (as well as Julia) backend does not handle such `do`s properly.

issue.title: C++ backend: fix do loops without a header
issue.body:
We use a while loop for that.

Fixes #821.

issue.title: test: integration test for no-var do-loop
issue.body:
I've done everything mentioned in https://github.com/lfortran/lfortran/pull/823#issuecomment-1264234047 to add the test for no-var do-loop case 

I have added a small program that counts the sum of digits of a number for the test.

I have a couple of doubts:
1. When I try to generate the cpp I get this:
    ```
    ❯ lfortran --show-cpp ./integration_tests/doloop_08.f90
    [1]    349292 segmentation fault (core dumped)  lfortran --show-cpp ./integration_tests/doloop_08.f90
    ```
    This is only happening in a no-var do-loop case.

2. I am not sure what labels must be added to the test in `integration_tests/CMakeLists.txt`

3. The test output looks like this which is failing because of another test
    <details>
    <summary>Test output</summary>
